RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 72. Claiming Purse 12500. (PLUS UP TO $6,250 THRIF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 1 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since May 1 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $8, 000, For Each $1,000 To $6,000 2 lbs. BC Bred Claiming $10,000, Three Year Old $12,000 (BC Bred $15,000). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $10,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: INDYETTA away alertly and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace from the inside of TAM TRICKY in the run down the backstretch and into the final turn, shook clear of her pace rival entering the lane, and drew clear in the drive. TAM TRICKY broke sharply and pressed the pace from the outside of INDYETTA entering the backstretch, continued to force the issue two wide into the final turn, was unable to match strides with her pace rival entering the lane, but finished willingly to prove second best. CARLA'S HONOR settled off the contested early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, commenced her bid from along the rail entering the final turn, and finished willingly from along the inside in the drive to garner a share. JUST MISTY was off a step slow and tracked the leaders into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, rallied smartly three wide entering the final turn, but was unable to make a late impact while finishing three out from the rail in the drive. TOBESUNNY unhurried early while trailing the field into the backstretch while racing out from the rail, rallied three wide entering the final turn, but was unable to mount a late bid while finishing two out from the rail in the drive.

ENTRY.NAME: Carla's Honor
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied inside, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Indyetta
ENTRY.OWNER: Albertson Brian and The Estate of Dennis Tucker
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led rail, rallied inside, drew clear

ENTRY.NAME: Just Misty
ENTRY.OWNER: Claggett Edwin MacPherson Craig and Armstrong Foster
ENTRY.COMMENT: step slow, tracked 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Tobesunny
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed throughout

ENTRY.NAME: Tam Tricky
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, pressed 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, 2nd best

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 2 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 87. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 18000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $16,000. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since June 1 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since May 1 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000, For Each $1,750 To $12,500 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered For Allowances). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $20,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BOITANO stalked the leaders entering the stretch the first time while saving ground at the rail, maintained his position into the backstretch, pulled his way into a tracking trip approaching the final turn, rallied smartly from along the rail through the turn, shifted two wide entering the lane, and inched clear from a stubborn BAKKEN OVERDRIVE late to prevail. BAKKEN OVERDRIVE away alertly and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace from the inside of STORMY BLUE through the second turn and in the run down the backside, shook clear of his pace rival entering the final turn to open a clear advantage, was collared by BOITANO leaving the turn, and was unable to fend off that foe late following a stretch long battle. WISELY PLAYED unhurried early while dropping back to trail, launched his bid three wide entering the final turn, and finished two out from the rail in the drive to garner a share. PRINCE CAIRO away well and stalked the leaders through the stretch the first time while racing two out from the rail, maintained his position in the run down the backstretch, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, but failed to mount a serious late bid when called upon. STORMY BLUE broke sharply and tracked the leader into the stretch the first time while racing one out from the rail, forced the issue two wide in the run down the backside, was unable to keep tabs on the pacesetter entering the final turn, and weakened over the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Boitano
ENTRY.OWNER: Snow Roger E Danard Don B and Rozenek Conrad
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked rail, rallied inside, closed 2 wide, inched clear

ENTRY.NAME: Bakken Overdrive
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led rail, clear lead, gave way grudgingly late

ENTRY.NAME: Prince Cairo
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, stalked 3 wide, rallied inside, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Wisely Played
ENTRY.OWNER: Wilson Warren Sutherland June Stajkowski Neil Hickman Barry and Small Lesley
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Stormy Blue
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, weakened 1/4

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 3 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 74. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 17000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $12,500. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since June 1 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since May 1 Allowed 4 lb s. Claiming Price $12,500, For Each $1,250 To $10,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $15,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LOLA M away well and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the stretch the first time, set a pressured pace from the inside of MISS THE HYPE in the run down the backstretch and through the final turn, got the better of that rival entering the lane, and drew clear late as much the best. MISS THE HYPE away alertly and tracked the leader through the stretch the first time while racing one out from the rail, pressed the pacesetter two wide in the run down the backstretch and through the final turn, was unable to match strides with that rival entering the lane, but finished willingly three wide in the drive to hold the place. QUALITY COMMAND broke sharply and tracked the leader through the stretch the first time while racing just out from the rail, maintained her position while racing two wide in the run down the backside, rallied one out from the rail entering the final turn, and finished evenly two wide in the drive. INDYGOGOLD unhurried early while dropping back to trail, bided her time at the back of pack in the run down the backside, rallied four wide entering the final turn, and finished three out from the rail in the drive. ICE BREAKER stalked the leader through the stretch the first time while racing one out from the rail, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but needed more when called upon late while finishing three wide in the drive. ARTISTIC JEWLER steadied off heels entering the stretch the first time, before racing into a stalking trip at the rail, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, but failed to mount a late bid when called upon. Following the running of this race, there was a jockey's claim of foul. The rider of ARTISTIC JEWELER lodged a claim of foul against the rider of QUALITY COMMAND for alleged interference leaving the first turn. After review the claim of foul was disallowed, and no change was made to the original order of finish.

ENTRY.NAME: Indygogold
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied 4 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Artistic Jewler
ENTRY.COMMENT: steadied early, stalked rail, rallied inside, lacked response

ENTRY.NAME: Quality Command
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked inside, rallied 2 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Lola M
ENTRY.OWNER: Nite and Day Stable Todd Joanne and S and D Holdings
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, led rail, rallied inside, drew clear

ENTRY.NAME: Ice Breaker
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Miss the Hype
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, pressed 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 4 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 60. Maiden Claiming Purse 14000. (PLUS UP TO $7,000 THRIF) FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000, For Each $1,750 To $12,500 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $20,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ROAD CLOSURE was off a step slow, and settled off the contested early pace while racing just out from the rail entering the first turn, raced into a stalking trip entering the backside, rallied smartly from along the rail entering the final turn and quickly assumed command entering the final turn, and was never seriously threatened late. BRIAN'S DE LEIGHT away alertly and raced to the lead one out from the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace in the run down the backstretch while racing out from the rail, was quickly overtaken from along the rail by ROAD CLOSURE entering the final turn, raced two wide through the turn, and finished evenly in the drive to prove clearly second best. HE'S A SAINT broke sharply and chased the pacesetter three wide into the first turn, forced the issue three wide in the run down the backside, rallied two wide through the final turn, but needed more when called upon while finishing three wide in the drive. MAGIC ROAD trailed the field into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, rallied with interest from along the rail entering the final turn, but flattened out in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Magic Road
ENTRY.OWNER: Danard Don B and Danard Sue
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed, rallied rail, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Road Closure
ENTRY.COMMENT: step slow, settled 2 wide, rallied rail, led, held

ENTRY.NAME: Brian's de Leight
ENTRY.OWNER: Wilson Warren Stajkowski Neil Sutherland June Switzer G Ross and Hickman Barry
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: He's a Saint
ENTRY.OWNER: Scott Robert Long William and McLeod Dan
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked 3 wide, rallied 2 wide, needed more

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Monashee H. HASTINGS RACE 5 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 89. Stakes Purse 50000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. By subscription of $100 to accompany the nomination by Midnight Saturday, June 24, 2023 with an additional $750 to enter and $1,000 to start. $50,000 guaranteed, of which 55% goes to the winner, 20% to sec ond, 10% to third, 5% to fourth and 4% to fifth, and 2% sixth through eighth, finishers nineth through twelfth will receive their starter fee back . High Weights preferred. Total earnings as recorded by Equibase in 2022-2023 will be used in determining p reference of horses assigned equal weights. Starters to be named through the entry box by closing time of entries. Field limited to 12 starters.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WE B THREE away well and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the stretch the first time, controlled the pace in the run down the backstretch and into the final turn, turned back a bid from RUN LOLA RUN through the final turn, and drew clear late under confident handling. RUN LOLA RUN broke sharply and stalked the leader through the stretch the first time while racing one out from the rail, began to advance midway down the backstretch to take up the chase two wide entering the final turn, was unable to keep tabs on the pacesetter entering the lane, but closed determinedly through the lane to prove clearly second best. SOLARITY trailed the field into the stretch the first time, commenced her bid two wide entering the final turn, and finished willingly three wide in the drive to garner a share. BAYAKOAS IMAGE clipped heels entering the first turn, almost unseating her rider, recovered to take a stalking trip from along the rail entering the stretch the first time, dropped back to trail in the run down the backside, rallied two wide entering the final turn, and finished four wide in the drive while unable to seriously threaten. SHAMRA away alertly and tracked the leaders into the stretch the first time while saving ground at the rail, maintained her position in the run down the backstretch, but was outfinished over the final furlong. REA MEA hopped at the start while tossing her head to get away awkwardly, rushed up three wide entering the first turn to take a tracking trip into the lane the first time, chased the pacesetter two wide in the run to the final turn, but faded over the final furlong. Following the running of this race there was a stewards inquiry into an incident entering the first turn. After review there was no change to the original order of finish.

ENTRY.NAME: Bayakoas Image
ENTRY.OWNER: Nite and Day Stable and Todd, Joanne
ENTRY.COMMENT: clip heels, stalked rail, rallied 2w, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Run Lola Run
ENTRY.OWNER: Gilbert George Gilbert Donna Potozny Larry and Godart Maria
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, stalked 2 w, advanced 3/8, rallied 2w, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Solarity
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Rea Mea
ENTRY.COMMENT: hopped start, tracked 2 wide, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Shamra
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, tracked rail, rallied inside, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: We B Three
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, led rail, clear lead, held

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Lieutenant Governors' H. HASTINGS RACE 6 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 94. Stakes Purse 50000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. By subscription of $100 to accompany the nomination by Midnight Saturday, June 24, 2023 with an additional $750 to enter and $1,000 to start. $50,000 guaranteed, of which 55% goes to the winner, 20% to second, 10% to third, 5% to fourth and 4% to fifth, and 2% sixth through eighth, finishers nineth through twelfth will receive their starter fee back. High Weights preferred. Total earnings as recorded by Equibase in 2022-2023 will be used in determining preference of horses assigned equal weights. Starters to be named through the entry box by closing time of entries. Field limited to 12 starters.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SOARINGFORTHESUN broke sharply and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the stretch the first time, set a pressured pace from along the rail in the run down the backstretch and into the final turn, held a narrow advantage into the lane, and inched clear in the late stages to prove best. BIG UNION away well and tracked the leaders through the stretch the first time while racing two out from the rail, maintained his position in the run down the backstretch, rallied three wide entering the final turn, and finished willingly one out from the rail in a game effort. AROLLERCOASTERRIDE tracked the leaders through the stretch the first time while saving ground at the rail, maintained his position in the run down the backstretch, rallied two wide entering the final turn, and found his best stride late while finishing three wide in the drive to get up for a share. PAY MY WAY settled off the early pace while saving ground at the rail, commenced his bid from along the rail entering the final turn, and finished six wide in the drive. FLORIDA GATOR dueled for the lead from the outside of SOARINGFORTHESUN through the stretch the first time, continued to force the issue two wide in the run down the backside and into the final turn, but faded over the final furlong. BE QUICK away alertly and stalked the contested early pace while racing just out from the rail, held his position in the run down the backstretch, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but failed to respond when called upon. ROOKIE YEAR settled off the early pace while racing one out from the rail through the stretch the first time, trailed the field in the run down the backside, rallied three wide into the final turn, but failed to make a late impact when called upon.

ENTRY.NAME: Soaringforthesun
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, vied rail, rallied inside, inched clear

ENTRY.NAME: Florida Gator
ENTRY.OWNER: Potozny Larry Langelaan Peter and Wil - A - Way Farm
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Big Union
ENTRY.OWNER: Rycroft Cathy Rycroft Kelly Dale Dennis Perry Tabitha and Benson Sheryle
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Arollercoasterride
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked rail, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Pay My Way
ENTRY.OWNER: Wilson Warren Stajkowski Neil Sutherland June Switzer G Ross and Hickman Barry
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied inside, closed 6 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Rookie Year
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, lacked response

ENTRY.NAME: Be Quick
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, stalked inside, rallied 2 wide, lacked response

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 7 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 80. Claiming Purse 14000. (PLUS UP TO $7,000 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 1 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since May 1 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000, For Each $1,7 50 To $12,500 2 lbs. BC Bred Claiming $20,000, Three Year Old $24,000 (BC Bred $30,000).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: EDDIE WHO chased the pacesetter into the first turn while drifting out slightly, but forced the issue two wide in the run down the backstretch, took a narrow advantage into the final turn, and held the closers safely at bay late. ACCORDINGLY settled off the contested early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, commenced his bid from just off the rail entering the final turn, and closed willingly three wide in the drive to finish on even terms with SHARPZAN. SHARPZAN settled off the early pace while racing one out from the rail entering the backstretch, commenced his bid three wide entering the final turn, and found his best stride late while finishing three out from the rail in the drive to finish on even terms with ACCORDINGLY. BACK SHACK broke sharply and tracked the leaders into the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, rallied three wide entering the final turn, but was outfinished in deep stretch while racing one out from the rail. BAK TO LIBERTY away alertly and tracked the leaders into the backstretch while racing just out from the rail, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but lacked the needed closing response when called upon while finishing four wide in the drive. KLIMTOGLORY unhurried early while dropping back to trail in the run to the first turn, bided his time at the back of the pack in the run down the backstretch, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but failed to mount a serious late bid when called upon. ROCKCLIFFE was fractious prior to the start, and hopped to get away a step slow, rushed up from along the rail to vie for the lead entering the first turn, set a pressured pace at the rail in the run down the backstretch, struggled to keep pace with EDDIE WHO entering he final turn, and weakened over the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Bak to Liberty
ENTRY.OWNER: Tod Mountain Thoroughbreds and Redekop James
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, tracked inside, rallied 2 wide, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: dh-Accordingly
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied inside, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Klimtoglory
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied 2 wide, never menaced

ENTRY.NAME: Rockcliffe
ENTRY.OWNER: Tod Mountain Thoroughbreds and Redekop James
ENTRY.COMMENT: fractious, hopped start, vied rail, rallied inside, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Eddie Who
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, led, held

ENTRY.NAME: Back Shack
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: dh-Sharpzan
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 4 wide,
